Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up
This HP printer is great for all-around printing! Easy to set up and quick printing make this great for school and work. The auto-duplexing saves paper, and the copy and scan features are easy to use. I haven't used the Fax feature yet, but expect to in the future.
I've read a lot of reviews that said the front touch panel was not sensitive enough and that you had to press real hard - on my unit, this is NOT TRUE! A moderate touch is all it takes to go from menu to menu, and the audio tones are soft and pleasant.
A great feature is the Web printing... you can send documents from anywhere to your printers unique email and it will print them out - waiting there for you, or you can print to someone who is waiting there for it. ... > I have not had the chance to print photos yet, but the adjustable paper tray makes it easy to load photo paper to 3x5. The tray is also expandable to handle A4 and legal size paper.
Scanning documents is a breeze! It will automatically scan both sides using the feeder and you can save documents to your computer, to a home network, or to a flash drive. You can also scan from the platten glass just as easy, and save in multiple formats.
The footprint is little bigger than most, but not overly large if you have a good table. It is a bit bulky, so it may not fit on the edge near a wall as you need space to lift the feeder to place items on the platten glass. Go look at it in a store to get a better idea. The reps at the Staples where I bought mine were very helpful!
One thing you should know (and this goes for MOST printers), is Paper type is important! For plain B&W docs, use regular multi-purpose paper. For items that will print color (graphs, images, etc.) use a better stock like laser paper. It looks nicer and the ink stays more on the surface of the paper. And of course if you want to print photos - use photo paper. HP has a great line of fast dry photo paper.
All-in-all, I find this printer a definite RECOMMEND! NOTE: I am not a power user printing tons of documents! But for general use, school papers, work docs, etc. this is a great item to have! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
My old 7000 series printer broke down, and I was disappointed to find it could not be repaired. Hewlett Packard was gracious and offered me this printer at a hugely discounted price. I absolutely loved my old printer, and was heartbroken that I had to purchase a new one. This turned out to be a blessing in disguise!
The printer is sleek, fast, easy to use, and the performance is outstanding. It was EXTREMELY easy to set up, and I had no problem connecting wirelessly to two computers. It is very user friendly, and I especially like the duplex capability. It is large, so you need quite a bit of space. However, I do not mind the size, as this is a workhorse and I print frequently.
Highly recommended!

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Good printer that isn't too expensive
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to setup, gets printing with not much hassel
Cons: Price is steep for people looking for a home printer
I use this mostly for personal printing but since I work from home it does get some business use as well. The price is over double what you'd spend on something like a normal HP Deskjet, but the performance to me is well worth it.
There is no need to use the crazy HP drivers that install all the bloatware on your desktop, and the network setup can be done all from the printer itself. This makes it very nice and hassle free to setup up right when you turn it on. I'm printing over wireless with WPA2 encryption and it it was a breeze to get it going.
The one thing that makes this far superior to normal Deskjet printers is the fact that it comes with a ... true paper tray instead of a hole that you slide paper in and hope that your printer sees it. To me it was worth the money to reduce hassle in printing when I need to, and reduce the bloat I put on my computer to enable it to print. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
The HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One printer is outstanding in quality, performance, and easy of use. It quietly spits out excellent quality documents and photos with amazing speed relative to my HP DeskJet 6127 printer.
I had the 8600 up and connecting wirelessly to my wi-fi network in minutes. And the printer's name appeared automatically in my iPad and iPod touch printer menus without having to install an app or configure the HP ePrint services for my IOS mobile devices; it just worked!
The adjustable color graphical touchscreen has an easy to follow layout, and the menu navigation controls makes accessing the printer's multi-function features a breeze. Scanning documents, using the glass-top or the document feeder, and sending the results to my e-mail inbox as a PD ... F attachment worked flawlessly. And the ability to use the printer's built-in web server to setup other functions, as well as to check for printer software updates, is perhaps its best feature.
The 8600 Plus is a sturdy and well designed product. However, one weak spot that HP should improve is to make the pull-out paper catch tray (not the paper input tray) slide smoothly when it is pushed back into the printer. The tray tends to stop or stick as it slides towards the printer.
I am very pleased with the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One. It is an amazing product, and I highly recommend its consideration for anyone shopping for a new, high-quality printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: The printer works fine and has some nice features (most are available on other brands), but the software and paper tray handler are not up to HP standards. I just recycled a 5-year old HPOJ-G85 that, when new, had better software than the new 8600. * My printer is in the basement. If I am outside when the phone rings and it is an incoming FAX, the 8600 does not "listen" for the FAX tones and automatically pick up. I cannot signal the 8600 FAX to pick up by pressing "1,2,3" on my phone as with previous software. No, I have to race to the basement and press the touchscreen to tell the machine to answer the incoming FAX (unless time has run out for the sending FAX machine) * The touch screen is not consistent in sensitivity. I pressed the "Copy" icon several times with no results, even ... though the icon blinked. Apparently, you have to press the icon in a particular place?? * The scan software does not show a crisp, clear image of the scanned document, making it difficult to determine if the scan will create a good image file. * I cannot print to a #10 envelope by just inserting the envelope on top of the paper in the tray. I have to remove the paper, put the envelope in the tray, adjust the tray's center-oriented guides to the width of the envelope, print the envelope and then repeat this process to put the paper in place. expand » « collapse

I found the touch screen unreliable. One third of the time accepting the selection with one touch. Other times required multiple touches to register the command. HP tech support suggested I try using my finger nail instead that worked sometimes, but other times it did not work. It was difficult to find a number to call at HP for tech support. One tech support person had trouble with English, a heavy accent and was difficult to understand. He gave me a phone number to call back as I had not enough time to be helped. He gave me the phone number for Apple tech support which was incorrect. I returned the unit to the store where I bought it, They exchanged with another. The new machine ... also had problems with the touch pad as did the one in the store. The tech person in the store tried the unit in the store the problem duplicated on the model on display. Then my replaced unit developed another problem the paper feeder after 2 days, It was properly filled with envelopes or paper and was unable to recognize there was paper in there tray. I go a message saying the paper feeder had no paper in it. HP tech support offered to send me what would have been a 3rd unit. I concluded this model is a lemon and decided on something else. Given the time needed to unpack, install setup wiring and pack up. I found this model a big waste of my valuable time. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
I have been buying HP printers for more than 20 years. This one was the easiest to set up in all that time! Follow the basic unpack & set up instructions, then plugin the disk or manually finish the connections to the computer, and it's ALL done! Print, fax & scan all set up in the same initial pass. No separate setups like in the past. Put it into wireless mode, all 3 computers & 2 smartphones could access it immediately. The unit sits in the same footprint as my past 3300, but is taller due to the sheet feeder. Noise level is lower than that one, and that one wasn't bad. I don't yet know what the ink consumption is, but the quality of printing, and the ability to print double-sided all look excellent.

Item.Review:
Pros: Usual HP quality mechanical components, good quality printouts & an excellent LCD screen on the front panel. Despite my cons, I recommend this unit as the best for the price range
Cons: drivers, as is usual for HP, leave a lot to be desired. They are difficult to load by a novice, incomplete & almost always require 2 or 3 attempts to install. I would think more effort would be put into them by HP. Customer service is lacking in many other ways, as well
designed for a second paper tray, which does not come with it, of course. The problem is, it's also not available anywhere, even at HP! All I get is "out of stock" everywhere, which tells me they are not being manufactured. I have not checked within the last week & hopefully the status will change.

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy To Set Up; Easy to Use; Fast printing; Efficient; Quality Construction
I did a great deal of research and talked to a couple of printer experts and two printers were always recommended. The HP 8600 Pro Premium and the Epson® Workforce® Pro WP-4530 All-in-One Printer. The Epson 4530 is the equivalent of the HP 8600 Pro Premium. After thoroughly physically comparing them I decided that the HP construction was more solid and had a smaller foot print. The HP 8600 premium has standard letter size and a legal size paper trays. Basically the many reviews gave equal kudos to both. The ink cartridges on both are easily installed. The ink cartridge prices were comparable. Both printers take separate ink cartridges of black, magenta, cyan and yellow. Both print n ... ice photos but if you want excellent photo printing buy a printer that is only a photo printer. Epson and Cannon have excellent photo printers. Over all it is cheaper to take your digital photos to a CVS or use a photo developer as it will be cheaper per print than using a photo printer which will use lots of ink. I finally decided to purchase the HP 8600 Pro Plus which comes with one paper tray that can accommodate standard and legal size paper. The only difference between the 8600 Pro Plus and the 8600 Pro Premium is the paper tray. Since I use standard size paper 99% of the time it is not an inconvenience for me to exchange the standard paper with the legal to print. If you use standard and legal often then you might want the HP 8600 Premium with two separate paper trays.
It was easy to set up using the CD. I checked online at HP and the CD that comes with the printer and the most current downloadable software had the same version numbers so I used the CD. Just follow the instructions and it should take about 30 minutes to install. The printer also has goggle cloud capabilities and it can easily be setup for this option; my daughter wanted this option so she can print from her iphone from anywhere in the world. HP's website had excellent online help. So far I am very happy with the printer and would not hesitate to purchase it again. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: HP has really hit the nail on the head with this printer, more so than ever before. I’ve used HP printers for 15+ years; at home, at work and at the home office. While I’ve been generally satisfied, I would rate my previous printers (an Officejet Pro 7410 and a Deskjet 932C) as no more than “adequate”. These previous printers have been functional with mediocre driver support and over-priced ink. Moving to the Officejet Pro 7410 was a huge step up in productivity and I would never settle for anything less than an all-in-one now. That printer came out in the Vista era, and as an avid hardware enthusiast, I upgraded to Win7 on day one. Since this OS came out after the printer, driver support was poor and I frequently had to reinstall the drivers to get things to work. Also, printing from my i ... Pads was not an option with that printer. I recently noticed that there was a sale at (the retailer named after the device that fastens sheets of paper together with a metal clip) for the Officejet Pro 8600 plus for 100 simoleans off MSRP. I took the plunge mainly for the Airprint support for the iPads. With this printer, HP has made HUGE strides in design, functionality and ease-of-use. Set up on my wired Ethernet connection was quick and painless and getting my Win7 64-bit setup was also easy. HP has taken a lot of cues from Apple in interface design and the improvement really shines in this hardware and software. The second aspect I appreciated was the separate color cartridges and I hope this translates to reduced ink costs. The only area I would rate this printer down is in its web based management interface, as this has not received the interface updates that the rest of the printer has. Win7 does not like the fact that all of the security certificates are not squared away and most of the screens have angry red highlights. I have also been impressed with HPs ePrint functionality. If I receive an email on my phone with an attachment I’d like to print, I simply forward it to my ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: DO NOT BUY IF PRINT ALOT OF PHOTOS
Item.Review:
Pros: Print speed is supper fast
Cons: prints horribly when it comes to photos
It is definitely not the must have printer of the year unless you use it strictly for business purposes such as scanning, copying, faxing and printing documents, spreadsheets or powerpoint etc. Any slick paper, such as photopaper it has an extremely hard time grabbing. Then when it finally does grab the paper (and this only happens if the paper is stacked all the way to its fullest compasity and I only get that by sticking a couple photo paper sheets on top then loading as much plain white paper undereneath as will fit in the tray) and prints the photo, it comes out decent enough but there is a streak or line every two inches across the snapshot. This doesn’t happen when a photo is printed on plain ... white paper. Program used doesn’t matter because I used powerpoint for both. On top of that the ink doesn't really stick well to the photo paper and a fingernail can easily scratch and ruin the photo. So if looking for a Proffesional grade printer this is definitely the one. It prints so fast papers nearly fly out. Words are crisp and clear. No streaking or blurriness. Scans are so near perfect they don’t look like they are scanned. Copies so vivid you can’t tell which is the copy or the original. Wireless signal has picked up both computer and laptop every time either one or both are turned on. Double sided gadet attached to the back has never failed. However, if you are looking for a Personal all-in-one save your money and look for something else like a photosmart all-in-one because no one wants lined photos. Clearly when best buy advertises this printer, the photo sticking out of its paper tray is not one it printed itself. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
After using this nice printer usually one can find a draw back. It prints great, it great copy options, the auto document feeder works great. It can even scan a document to a folder on my computer on the network in my house. Setup was easy as can be. Many more fun options.
One small gripe is that its ability to pickup cardstock on the first go. This includes business cards, I have to push ok, four times before it picks up the paper. But once to have done that, the rest of the copies made pick up fine. Even if you stop printing and realize you need one more, it prints fine. Until you go back to plan and back to cardstock. Maybe this could be fixed in a firmware update. To which I hope this helps both you and HP.

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a nice Printer, has good features.
Item.Review:
This is a very nice printer, Prints fast, lazer quality printing, good color, large paper feeder, fax works great, great for coping, in fact the copies look better than the originals copied, scanner is easy to operate, not the best I have seen but it does the job.
The biggest draw back to this printer is, it is very difficult to print card stock. Most of the time, 65 to 67 pound card stock will not load at first, the out of paper light will come on. However, if you continue to press the out of paper light 3 to 5 times the paper finally will load and print. But, if you have more than one card to print, I print 100 at a time, it will take you several hours because of the feeding problem - it can be done but with much frustration. Card stock over 67 pounds will not feed through. ... >However, aside from the minor card feeding problem I find this printer serves me well, it does a very nice job on printing, in fact I think the printing is as sharp and clear as a lazer printer, but in the end it uses a lot of ink.
Over all I would buy this printer again and recommend it to my friends and family; and the only reason I don't give it 4 stars is be cause of the difficulity in printing card stock, but other than that this is a great printer! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: This Printer is the Best Inkjet Yet
Item.Review:
First, let me state that I did extensive research before purchasing this printer. I looked at the reviews on several websites, including customer reviews. I would like to address some of the negative reviews because I believe they are unfounded.
This printer is a breeze to setup. The on-screen display guides you through setup step by step. It is pretty much idiot proof.
I would recommend you download the drivers right off the HP site. Do not use the provided CD. Drivers are constantly updated, so you are better off getting them right off the manufacturer site than loading them from a CD that may be a few weeks or months old.
For those who gave a negative review, it sounds to me like you might be computer illiterate. Please work with a friend or family member who knows ... how to setup and configure a computer and printer and you should have no problems.
As for the printers features and performance, I have an Ipad and Iphone as well as a Dell laptop. It works with all 3 devices. Printing is very quick and the quality is excellent.
If you are in the market for a All-In-One Inkjet for home or small office needs, I would highly recommend this unit. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: Does not and never has correctly communicated wirelessly with the computers (two laptop & one desktop) after going into the energy saving mode. Nor does the scanning work consistently. Will be scanning documents one moment and then the next document will not scan. Have to turn the wireless settings from on to off and back to on to get the communication back up and at times have to turn the printer off then back on. Have spoken with all levels of HP tech support and they want me to hardwire the printer even though it is suppose to function wirelessly. It has been six months, earlier HP stated they were aware of the problem and were working on a software patch, none forthcoming and 6 months is enough waiting. We will see if HP will replace it.

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Low Ink Consumption; Reliable; Durable construction; Easy To Set Up; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use
Cons: Loses wi-fi connection
I am a teacher and print heavily at home. This printer is faster than my printer at school for both quick print and duplex printing. It's worth the paper and ink to have it done at home! I love the fact that I can email docs to my printer and have them waiting at home, it's like a personal to-do list. We've owned a Brother all-in-one and the ADF would pull multiple documents in when scanning so I couldn't scan more than one page at a time. This not only scans from the ADF, it will scan double-sided documents and the end result is amazing. I've had it jam twice but it was a quick and painless fix. My one complaint is that it occasionally l ... oses the wi-fi connection, but that is a Knology issue as well. I have to unplug the printer and reset my router/modem in order to get the signal back up. A quick fix now that I know what the problem is, but it certainly caused me grief at first. I love the capacity of the paper feed tray, the ink consumption is excellent. I use a cartridge every 5-6 weeks (black) but I print hundreds of pages each week. I couldn't be happier with this purchase. An EXCELLENT value for the price! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Not worth it for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Sets up fairly easily, all in one, paper tray for large quantity
Cons: can't set custom paper sizes, too many no paper in tray messages,
Can't believe that a machine that costs $230 doesn't have the custom paper option. Bought it because my photosmart started to go and needed a good machine really quickly. Plus the sales rep said it was a work horse... It it... if you're printing regular size documents. I do invitations and this machine only allows you to print on preset paper sizes which doesn't help me one bit. I called HP and the guy on the phone took me through 20 minutes of nonsense to tell me you can only choose one of the paper sizes listed, you can't edit the paper size. Plus the print quality was way less than that of the photo smart I have, then it smudged ink ... on the back of all the RSVP cards for an order I was working on... wasted 20 sheets of paper.... Not to mention when I first hit print, it kept saying paper try is empty. I had to fidget with the paper tray for several minutes before it started to print... So I took it back the next day. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent quality & value for small Biz
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Reliable; Easy To Use; Fast Print Time
Cons: A bit noisy
For a couple of home businesses, this is a great starter printer. Haven't had it long enough to determine how fast it goes thru ink, but as for wireless response, phenomenal!!!! Copies, scans, prints very quickly; never had a jam yet. The lid is not hinged, which at first led me to believe it was defective, but that feature is to allow for the copying of large books in bindings. The plastic construction does appear to be somewhat flimsy, but that's to be expected [*] Otherwise fully satisfied at the moment. Touch screen is fantastic. Staples sale price plus another $50 case refund to turn in a old printer makes this an excellent value for [$].

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: What a great all in one printer
Item.Review:
Pros: Efficient; Easy to Use; Reliable; Quality Construction; Easy To Set Up
I did a lot of research and I didn't find another printer with all the features at a better price. I really like the duplex printing and the fact the there are seperate cartridges for each color. The touch control panel is a great feature also. The setup for my network was easy and didn't take five minutes to do. HPs software made the installlation process very, very easy. Overall I would buy the Officejet 8600 Plus again!

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: Bought this to replace a 4 year old network color laser all in one. Two main features I needed was Apple Air Print (print from iPhones/Ipad/IPod Touches) and duplex printing. Basically came down to this one vs the Epsom Workforce. Liked the look & feel of the HP better plus I didn't like the back side feed for envelopes on the Epsom. So far I'm impressed. Cons: Print quality on cheap paper has been only okay on fast settings. On good ink jet paper and slower settings it does just fine I wish it had an easy single feed for things like envelopes Pros: Fast! Easy to use with Apple "i" products. Quiet and more energy efficient than my old color laser. Web connect is kind of cool.

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: I really liked this printer/scanner/all-in-one. I haven't actually had much chance/need to print yet, so I can't comment on that part. I've only printed the initial alignment page. It looked good. I've been using the scanner functionality. I setup a network share on my laptop, connected the printer to my wireless, and that part works perfectly. Exactly what I was looking for. The touchscreen is awesome!
Cons: I've been scanning in old bills/payment receipts (regular letter size paper) and over the past few days I've scanned maybe 60-70 pages. Some with the flatbed, but mainly with the ADF. I scanned maybe 10-15 today and the ADF started to act up. It won't pick up the paper anymore. Or it really struggles to. I'm feeding these in one at a time, so I'm used to the p ... rocess. There is a nice paper sensor sound that goes off, there is a physical "limit" to how far the paper needs to be inserted, and now the rollers will just spin, the paper will just creep in or I'll get a message that the paper needs to be reloaded. There is also a different sound now to the rollers trying to pick up the paper. It leans toward a grinding sound. I can't use this. I'm going to check out HP's website for troubleshooting, but this thing is most likely going back. I tried to scan in previous documents that had no issue thinking maybe the paper was a problem, but those have an issue too now.
When scanning, I wish there was a "repeat" action. When scanning individual papers, I have to press "Network Folder" > My Scan Location I setup > Scan. If I could just hit Scan this process would be much easier to scan individual documents. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One N911g Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
First the Cons - There aren't any
Now the Pros - HP hit a grand slam with this one.
It is remarkably quieter, much less time to start up, and prints faster and my HP8500.
The print quality is excellent with crisp, clear letters, very good grey scale, and rich text colors. It also uses less ink than my HP8500
Set-up took approximately 15 minutes which included one desk top and the wireless function for two laptop computers.
Full function includes duplex copying printing scanning and faxing.
I do a lot of duplex printing. I have not had a paper jam - I've already put 10 or 12 rems of paper through my printer.
Large reserve (250 sheets) of paper so I am not endlessly adding paper all day.
